title: My Client (Both Alpha and Legacy) are broken to the point where I can't play League.
body:
So I logged into the Alpha Client, like I've been doing for the past week, and the first thing I noticed was that my icon was just a black circle with a white square at the top left. I then tried to load into an ARAM and rather then a background it was just black. The que popped and I accepted the game, I was not able to see any of the champions or skins or anything. I clicked my mastery page to edit it, but all my mastery pages were gone and I can not see the masteries or edit them in any way. So to be clear, I have no idea who I am playing and even if I did I can't change my runes or masteries. I ended up que dodging because it was such a mess.

Next I opened the client again and tried to go to the Legacy client, I opened it and logged in, but this one just stayed a black screen once I was in. So to be clear, I was actually in the client, just it was all black and I couldn't do anything.

replies.body:
It sounds like you may want to run a quick repair of the client in case this is caused by a lot of missing assets. Hit the cog at the top right of the client, then select *initiate full repair*. 

If you still have issues afterwards, let me know.
I did a repair, it made it so I could use the Legacy client again, but not the Alpha client. All the problems I was having with the Alpha Client are still there.

Since a repair resolved your issues with the Legacy Client, I suspect your Beta Client assets are completely borked. I'd recommend completely reinstalling League by using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) in order to resolve this. Simply open the app, then check the boxes for *Reinstall* and *Clean uninstall*, then hit Start. After the process has completed, launch League in order to complete patching and to initiate the Beta Client upgrade.

Let me know the results.
